title: Concentration inequality registry
description: Implement all concentration bounds from Section 4.1 of the design doc. Each bound is a callable computing required sample size from tolerance, failure_prob, and declared properties. Includes Chebyshev, median-of-means, Catoni, Hoeffding, Anderson, Maurer-Pontil, Bentkus, Bernstein, sub-Gaussian.

title: Implement Chebyshev bound
description: n = ceil(sigma^2 / (delta * epsilon^2)). Requires: variance. The loosest bound; 1/delta dependence. Applicable to any distribution with finite variance.

title: Implement bound registry and applicability filtering
description: Create the BOUND_REGISTRY list/dict of all BoundStrategy instances. Implement filtering logic: a bound is applicable if its required_properties is a subset of the user's declared properties, and it supports the requested side (two-sided/greater/less).

title: Unit tests for all concentration bounds
description: Write tests for each bound's compute_n function. Verify: correct n for known inputs, monotonicity in tolerance/failure_prob, edge cases (delta near 0/1, epsilon near 0). Test that bounds with more information yield smaller n than weaker bounds on the same inputs.

title: Implement median-of-means bound
description: k = ceil(8 ln(2/delta)), n = k * ceil(2 sigma^2 / epsilon^2). Requires: variance. Achieves sub-Gaussian ln(1/delta) rate with only finite variance. Strictly dominates Chebyshev for delta < ~0.15.

title: Implement Catoni bound
description: n = ceil(C_p * (M / epsilon^p)^(2/(p+1)) * ln(2/delta)^(p/(p+1))). Requires: moment_bound=(p, M). For heavy-tailed distributions with fractional moments p > 1. Includes C_p constant computation.

title: Implement Hoeffding bound
description: n = ceil((b-a)^2 * ln(2/delta) / (2 epsilon^2)). Requires: bounds=(a,b). The workhorse baseline for bounded random variables.

title: Implement Anderson bound
description: n = ceil((b-a)^2 * ln(1/delta) / (2 epsilon^2)). Requires: bounds=(a,b), symmetric=True. Factor-of-2 improvement over Hoeffding for symmetric distributions.

title: Implement Maurer-Pontil bound
description: Empirical Bernstein bound using observed sample variance. Requires: bounds=(a,b). Cannot solve n in closed form a priori -- uses conservative Hoeffding n then verifies post-hoc. Report effective savings in verbose output.

title: Implement Bentkus bound
description: One-sided refinement of Hoeffding via Binomial tail. Requires: bounds=(a,b). ~20-40% reduction in n for one-sided tests. Computing n requires numerically inverting the Binomial tail via bisection at config time.

title: Implement Bernstein bound
description: n = ceil((2 sigma^2 ln(2/delta)) / epsilon^2 + (2(b-a) ln(2/delta)) / (3 epsilon)). Requires: bounds=(a,b), variance. Tighter than Hoeffding when sigma^2 << (b-a)^2/4.

title: Implement sub-Gaussian bound
description: n = ceil(2 sigma^2 ln(2/delta) / epsilon^2). Requires: sub_gaussian_param=sigma. For light-tailed unbounded distributions satisfying the MGF condition.

title: Core data model and configuration
description: Define the foundational data structures: BoundStrategy, decorator parameter validation, tolerance model (atol + rtol * |expected|), and configuration error types. Everything else builds on these.

title: Define BoundStrategy dataclass
description: Create the BoundStrategy dataclass with fields: name, required_properties (set[str]), optional_properties (set[str]), compute_n (callable), supports_side (callable), estimator_type (enum), and description. This is the core abstraction all bounds implement.

title: Define EstimatorType enum
description: Create enum for estimator types: SAMPLE_MEAN, MEDIAN_OF_MEANS, CATONI_M_ESTIMATOR. Each BoundStrategy declares which estimator it requires.

title: Implement tolerance model
description: Implement the tolerance calculation: tol = atol + rtol * |expected|. Validate that at least one of atol/rtol is positive, and raise ConfigurationError if expected=0 with rtol>0 and atol=0.

title: Define configuration error types
description: Create exception hierarchy: ConfigurationError (base), NoApplicableBoundError, InvalidToleranceError, InvalidPropertyError. Used throughout for clear diagnostics.

title: Define TestConfig dataclass
description: Create TestConfig holding all resolved decorator parameters: expected, tol, failure_prob, bounds, variance, sub_gaussian_param, symmetric, moment_bound, side. This is the validated input to the bound selection engine.

title: Test execution runtime
description: The core runtime that calls the user's test function n times, collects samples, applies the chosen estimator, and asserts the result falls within tolerance. Includes RNG injection, seed reporting on failure, and support for two-sided/one-sided tests.

title: Implement RNG injection
description: Inspect the test function signature for an 'rng' parameter. If present, inject a numpy.random.Generator seeded per test run. Record the seed so it can be reported on failure for reproducibility. If no rng param, skip injection.

title: Implement sample collection loop
description: Call the user's test function n times, collecting scalar return values into a numpy array. Validate that returns are numeric scalars. Handle exceptions from the test function gracefully with clear error messages.

title: Implement assertion logic (two-sided and one-sided)
description: Two-sided: assert |estimator - expected| < tol. One-sided greater: assert estimator > expected - tol. One-sided less: assert estimator < expected + tol. Generate clear failure messages including observed value, expected, tol, n, and bound used.

title: Implement failure reporting with seed
description: On test failure, report: the seed used, observed value, expected value, tolerance, n, which bound was selected, and a command to reproduce the failure deterministically.

title: Unit tests for test execution runtime
description: Test: RNG injection works and is reproducible with same seed, sample collection handles n correctly, assertion logic for two-sided/one-sided, failure messages contain expected information.

title: Write Concentration Bounds Reference (docs/bounds.md)
description: Mathematical reference for all 9 concentration inequalities in the registry: Chebyshev, Median-of-means, Catoni, Hoeffding, Anderson, Maurer-Pontil, Bentkus, Bernstein, Bernstein (tuned), Sub-Gaussian. For each: formula (using MathJax), required properties, when it's selected, intuition, and relative sample cost. Include the selection algorithm explanation and the property-to-bound hierarchy table. Use the formulas and exposition from plan.md sections 4.1-4.2.

title: Documentation site with MkDocs Material
description: Build a modern documentation website for pytest-stochastic using MkDocs Material with mkdocstrings. Includes getting started guide, user guide, concentration bounds reference, tune mode guide, API reference, and deployment configuration.

title: Write Configuration Reference (docs/configuration.md)
description: Document the .stochastic.toml file format: TOML schema, what each field means (variance, observed_range, tuned_at, n_tune_samples), how test keys are derived from node IDs, how to manually edit or override values, and how the file is merged on re-tuning. Also document the pytest.ini/pyproject.toml options (filterwarnings for stochastic marker).

title: Write Getting Started guide (docs/getting-started.md)
description: Step-by-step tutorial: install, write your first stochastic test, run it, read the output. Cover: pip install, writing a simple @stochastic_test for a fair coin, running with pytest -v, interpreting the verbose output (bound name, n, observed value). Then show how adding more properties (variance) reduces n. End with pointer to the full User Guide.

title: Suppress anderson_ksamp UserWarning in distributional test
description: The anderson distributional test produces a scipy UserWarning about p-value capping. Either suppress it inside the decorator with warnings.filterwarnings or add it to the pytest filterwarnings config so test output is clean.

title: Tune mode (--stochastic-tune)
description: Implement the offline tuning step from Section 4.3: profile tests with many samples, compute rigorous one-sided upper confidence bounds for variance, persist to .stochastic.toml, load tuned parameters on subsequent runs.

title: Implement tune execution loop
description: When --stochastic-tune is active, run each stochastic test function n_tune times (default 50000, configurable via --stochastic-tune-samples). Collect all samples for analysis.

title: Compute variance upper confidence bound
description: From n i.i.d. samples, compute rigorous one-sided upper confidence bound on true variance using chi-squared quantile: sigma^2_upper = (n-1) * sigma_hat^2 / chi^2_{delta_tune}(n-1). Must be an upper bound, not a point estimate, to preserve failure_prob guarantees.

title: Implement .stochastic.toml persistence
description: Write/read tuned parameters to .stochastic.toml. Schema per test: [tests.<module>::<test_name>] with fields variance, observed_range, tuned_at (ISO timestamp), n_tune_samples. Load at test startup and merge with declared properties.

title: Implement Bernstein (tuned) variant
description: When tuned variance_upper is available from .stochastic.toml, use it in the Bernstein formula instead of a user-declared variance. Register this as a separate bound in the registry so it competes in the selection algorithm.

title: Integration tests for tune mode
description: Test full tune workflow: run --stochastic-tune on a test, verify .stochastic.toml is created with correct schema, run the test again, verify it uses tuned parameters and selects Bernstein (tuned).

title: Add py.typed marker for PEP 561
description: Add an empty py.typed file to src/pytest_stochastic/ so that type checkers (mypy, pyright) can use the package's inline type annotations. This is needed for downstream consumers who type-check their code.

title: Bound selection engine
description: Implement the selection algorithm from Section 4.2: enumerate applicable bounds, compute n for each, pick minimum. Includes estimator selection (sample mean vs median-of-means vs Catoni M-estimator) and the Maurer-Pontil opportunistic upgrade logic.

title: Implement select_bound algorithm
description: Core function: given declared properties, tolerance, failure_prob, and side, filter applicable bounds from the registry, compute n for each, return the one with minimum n. Raise NoApplicableBoundError if none apply.

title: Implement estimator dispatch
description: When the selected bound requires a non-standard estimator (median-of-means or Catoni M-estimator), automatically substitute it. Sample mean is the default. The dispatch maps EstimatorType to the corresponding aggregation function.

title: Implement median-of-means estimator
description: Split n samples into k blocks, compute the mean of each block, return the median. k = ceil(8 ln(2/delta)). Used automatically when median-of-means bound is selected.

title: Implement Catoni M-estimator
description: Implement Catoni's robust M-estimator using a truncated influence function. Used for heavy-tailed distributions where only fractional moments exist. Solve for mu_hat via the fixed-point equation involving the influence function.

title: Implement Maurer-Pontil opportunistic upgrade
description: After collecting Hoeffding's n samples (when bounds declared but no variance), retroactively check whether the Maurer-Pontil bound is satisfied with fewer samples. Report the effective n in verbose output. When tuned variance is available, use it for a tighter initial n.

title: Unit tests for bound selection
description: Test that: bounds-only selects Hoeffding/Maurer-Pontil, bounds+variance selects Bernstein, bounds+symmetric selects Anderson, moment_bound selects Catoni, variance-only selects median-of-means over Chebyshev. Verify correct estimator is dispatched for each.

title: Write API Reference (docs/api.md)
description: Auto-generated API reference using mkdocstrings. Set up ::: directives for all public API: pytest_stochastic.stochastic_test, pytest_stochastic.distributional_test, pytest_stochastic.BoundStrategy, pytest_stochastic.TestConfig, pytest_stochastic.EstimatorType, pytest_stochastic.ConfigurationError and subclasses. Configure mkdocstrings to show signatures, docstrings, and type annotations.

title: Add docs build/serve commands to CLAUDE.md
description: Update CLAUDE.md to include 'uv run mkdocs serve' and 'uv run mkdocs build' in the Commands section. Add a Documentation section explaining the docs structure and how to contribute.

title: Add docs dependencies to pyproject.toml
description: Add mkdocs-material, mkdocstrings[python], and mkdocs-gen-files to the dev dependency group in pyproject.toml.

title: Write Tune Mode guide (docs/guide/tune-mode.md)
description: Document the --stochastic-tune workflow end-to-end. Cover: what tuning does (profiles test functions, computes variance UCB, persists to .stochastic.toml), the CLI options (--stochastic-tune, --stochastic-tune-samples), the .stochastic.toml file format with example output, how tuned parameters are loaded automatically on subsequent runs, the math behind the variance UCB (chi-squared confidence bound), and when/how often to re-tune.

title: Write User Guide: RNG injection and reproducibility (docs/guide/rng.md)
description: Explain the RNG injection mechanism: if the test function has an 'rng' parameter, a numpy.random.Generator is injected automatically. Cover: how seeds work, reproducing failures from the reported seed, using seed= for deterministic tests, and managing your own randomness when rng is not in the signature.

title: pytest plugin integration
description: Wire everything into pytest as a plugin: conftest hooks, collection of stochastic tests, verbose reporting (bound used, n, observed value), and the --stochastic-tune CLI flag.

title: Implement pytest plugin hooks
description: Register the plugin via the pytest11 entry point. Implement pytest_collection_modifyitems or similar hooks to detect @stochastic_test-decorated functions and run them through the stochastic runtime instead of normal pytest execution.

title: Implement verbose reporting
description: In -v mode, report for each stochastic test: which bound was selected, n used, observed value, expected value, tolerance. Format: 'test_name PASSED [bernstein, n=2104, observed=0.502]'.

title: Register --stochastic-tune CLI option
description: Add the --stochastic-tune and --stochastic-tune-samples flags to the pytest CLI via pytest_addoption. When --stochastic-tune is passed, switch execution mode to tuning instead of testing.

title: Integration tests for pytest plugin
description: Use pytester fixture to test the full plugin lifecycle: write a test file with @stochastic_test, run it via pytest, verify it passes/fails correctly, check verbose output format.

title: Write User Guide: @stochastic_test decorator (docs/guide/stochastic-test.md)
description: Comprehensive reference for the @stochastic_test decorator. Document every parameter (expected, atol, rtol, failure_prob, bounds, variance, sub_gaussian_param, symmetric, moment_bound, side, seed) with types, defaults, and examples. Cover the tolerance model (tol = atol + rtol * |expected|), the property hierarchy table from plan.md showing which properties unlock which bounds, and best practices for choosing parameters.

title: Write landing page (docs/index.md)
description: Write the documentation homepage: what pytest-stochastic is, the core value prop (declare properties, framework picks the tightest bound, computes sample size, runs the test), a minimal install command (pip install pytest-stochastic), and a compelling 10-line example showing @stochastic_test in action. Include badges and a feature overview grid.

title: Write User Guide: @distributional_test decorator (docs/guide/distributional-test.md)
description: Document the @distributional_test decorator for testing full output distributions. Cover all parameters (reference, test, significance, n_samples, seed), the three supported tests (ks, chi2, anderson) with explanations of when to use each, and examples comparing a sampler against scipy distributions.

title: Decorator API (@stochastic_test and @distributional_test)
description: Implement the user-facing decorator API from Section 3. Includes parameter validation, integration with the bound selection engine, and the pytest marker/hook wiring.

title: Implement @stochastic_test decorator
description: The main decorator from Section 3.1. Accepts: expected, atol, rtol, failure_prob, bounds, variance, sub_gaussian_param, symmetric, moment_bound, side. Validates parameters, builds TestConfig, wires into the bound selection engine and runtime.

title: Implement decorator parameter validation
description: Validate: at least one of atol/rtol positive, at least one property declared (bounds/variance/sub_gaussian_param/moment_bound), side is one of 'two-sided'/'greater'/'less', bounds is a 2-tuple with a < b, moment_bound is (p, M) with p > 1.

title: Implement @distributional_test decorator
description: Thinner wrapper from Section 3.6. Accepts: reference distribution (scipy), test type ('ks'/'chi2'/'anderson'), significance level, n_samples. Runs n_samples draws, applies the chosen statistical test, asserts p-value > significance.

title: Integration tests for decorator API
description: End-to-end tests: decorate a simple function (e.g., rng.random()), run it, verify it passes. Test with different property combinations (bounds only, bounds+variance, etc.). Test that invalid configs raise ConfigurationError. Test distributional_test with known distributions.

title: Create mkdocs.yml configuration
description: Set up mkdocs.yml with Material theme, mkdocstrings plugin, navigation structure, syntax highlighting, math support (MathJax for concentration inequality formulas), and site metadata. Configure the nav to include: Home, Getting Started, User Guide (with sub-pages), Bounds Reference, Tune Mode, API Reference, Configuration Reference.
